definition: to defrost/to get rid of ice
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: But smaller sensors or road de-icing systems?
sentences.chinese: 但对更小的传感器或道路除冰系统而言？

sentences.english: By replacing structural module, deicing robot can be transformed into line inspection robot.
sentences.chinese: 应用模块化结构设计及仿生学原理设计了除冰机器人。

sentences.english: Some ideas of anti-icing and deicing of the cryogenic liquid underwater draining vent are presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了低温液体水下排放口防冰除冰设想。

sentences.english: Multifold techniques and methods of anti-icing and deicing are summarized.
sentences.chinese: 总结了目前国内外提出的多种防冰除冰技术及方法。

sentences.english: It is also a supplier of boot de-icing systems for business and regional aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 固特异还是公务机和支线客机的除冰系统供应商。

sentences.english: Larger impact force can be obtained when the robot impacts to deice.
sentences.chinese: 在机器人冲击除冰时，也可以获得更大的冲击力。

sentences.english: Anti-icing equipment will also be included for a total installed weight of 63 pounds.
sentences.chinese: 除冰系统也包含在系统63磅重量之内。

sentences.english: The bad weather forced an icebreaking ship in the Dutch port of Rotterdam into service for the first time in 12 years.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰鹿特丹港则在12年来首次动用了破冰船来除冰。

definition: to repair in a rush/rush repairs
to troubleshoot/to check components individually for problems/troubleshooting
to rush through urgently (e.g. emergency supplies)
